item.title: Bootstrap Overview
item.description: What is Bootstrap? Front-end framework created by engineers at Twitter Initially created to address the issue of having inconsistent user interfaces across their internal web applications Has since become the most popular mobile first (responsive) framework on the web Collection of html, css, js and fonts Documentation can be found here Benefits of Bootstrap Fully responsive out of the box Consistent design

item.title: Bootstrap Grid
item.description: Overview of Bootstrap’s Grid Bootstrap offers developers a mobile-first grid with 12 columns Float-based grid (the next version of bootstrap will use a flex-based grid) Built-in classes are used to control the widths of boxes within a bootstrap grid Containers Bootstrap requires a containing element to house its grid system To create a containing element add a class of container or container-fluid to a parent container

item.title: Form Overview
item.description: What are forms? Forms allow us to get data from users How do forms work? Form Structure <form action="http://www.example.com/subscribe.php" method="get"> <p>This is where the form controls will appear.</p> </form> Form Attributes action: Required, the url on the server that will receive the information from the form method: Either a get or post Use get when the data being sent to server is not senstive information and is relatively small (search form) Use post when sending senstive data and when sending large amounts of data (registration form)
